Prompt（画像生成用）

A serene gallery-like space inside a renovated Showa-era Japanese house in Kagurazaka, Tokyo, used as an independent bookstore and mini gallery called “Tomoshibi Book Lounge”.
Overhead view of a wooden table displaying carefully arranged little press books and handmade ZINEs with subtle design details.
Natural neutral tones — soft gray, pale wood, gentle green — illuminated by diffused daylight from a paper-shoji window.
Quiet, minimalist, and poetic composition with generous negative space for text.
The atmosphere feels like “a small festival of publishing,” modern yet nostalgic, calm and contemplative.
Minimal Japanese typography, softly integrated into the image:
Title: “Little Press & ZINE Fair”
Subtitle: “古民家ギャラリースペースで繰り広げられる特別なこの期間”
Small logo text at bottom right: “灯（ともしび）ブックラウンジ”
No people, no harsh shadows — emphasize texture of paper, light, and stillness.
Photography style: modern Japanese editorial, airy composition, natural lighting, depth of field.

Negative Prompt（除外するもの）

avoid clutter, bright vivid colors, strong contrast, dark or moody tone, messy table, digital screens, excessive text, human faces, cartoonish style
